content.html: Well, it‚Äôs half nine on a Friday night, so I might as well keep scanning I think. I‚Äôm getting a few more things uploaded to Commons, and trying not to get too drawn into reading about the 1930s aviation stuff.

content.html:
I‚Äôm trying to add a plain-text export option to Twyne (of varying sorts: LaTeX and Markdown to start with). I couldn‚Äôt figure out why my code wasn‚Äôt working.

Turns out there is no mime type called text/pain.

content.html:
I really do like Thunderbird. It‚Äôs such a great email client, and having actual local software feels like such a rare thing these days. I think my favourite features are

  1. local folders, so I can store email actually where I want (and sync it into Nextcloud‚Ä¶ but that‚Äôs another story); and
  2. one-button automatic annual archiving (select emails, hit a, and they‚Äôre moved to year-named folders on my local disk).

The one thing I don‚Äôt like at the moment is that I can‚Äôt easily switch to Maildir (from Mbox) as the storage format. I‚Äôve only ever, in 22 years of paying attention to this sort of thing, had a problem. But that did annoy me, that one time that I got a corrupted email folder! (Actually, I haven‚Äôt really looked at the state of Thunderbird‚Äôs Maildir support recently, so I‚Äôm probably way out of date on this.)
content.value:

The one thing I don‚Äôt like at the moment is that I can‚Äôt easily switch to Maildir (from Mbox) as the storage format. content.html:
It‚Äôs a day of ‚Äúother people‚Äôs servers having dramas‚Äù. This morning, matrix.org was down, and now masto.host is being all 403ish.

At least my server is always intermittent and liable to Guru Meditation, so it‚Äôs far more reliable. Or consistent. Or something.

content.html:
Pattypan is a great tool for uploading lots of files to Commons. I‚Äôm using it today for a set of scans of airgraphs. I scanned them all yesterday, and gave them hopefully-useful filenames that contain a prefix, date, and bit of info about each. These documents all look pretty much the same when viewed as thumbnails, so it‚Äôs important to be able to determine at least something by glancing at the filename. That said, it‚Äôs never good to ‚Äò‚Äòrely‚Äô‚Äô on metadata being in the filename nor on all files having the same structure to their names.

Anyway, after creating the spreadsheet for these files, I did some tweaking to the data columns:

  1. Filled the source column based on the name column:
    • Formula: =CONCAT("{{HMW|wiki=",B2,"}}")
    • Result: {{HMW|wiki=Airgraph 1943-12-30 Adele to Murray}}
  2. Extracted the date:
    • Formula: =REGEX(B3,"[0-9]{4}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{2}")
    • Result: 1943-12-30
  3. Crucially, any column that uses a formula needs to be copied to a new column with ‚Äò‚Äòvalues only‚Äô‚Äô (i.e. ‚ÄúEdit / Paste special / Values only‚Äù). Otherwise Pattypan can‚Äôt see the formula result.
content.value:
Pattypan is a great tool for uploading lots of files to Commons. I‚Äôm using it today for a set of scans of airgraphs. I scanned them all yesterday, and gave them hopefully-useful filenames that contain a prefix, date, and bit of info about each. These documents all look pretty much the same when viewed as thumbnails, so it‚Äôs important to be able to determine at least something by glancing at the filename. That said, it‚Äôs never good to ‚Äò‚Äòrely‚Äô‚Äô on metadata being in the filename nor on all files having the same structure to their names.
Anyway, after creating the spreadsheet for these files, I did some tweaking to the data columns:

Filled the source column based on the name column:

Formula: =CONCAT("{{HMW|wiki=",B2,"}}")

Result: {{HMW|wiki=Airgraph 1943-12-30 Adele to Murray}}



Extracted the date:

Formula: =REGEX(B3,"[0-9]{4}-[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{2}")

Result: 1943-12-30



Crucially, any column that uses a formula needs to be copied to a new column with ‚Äò‚Äòvalues only‚Äô‚Äô (i.e. ‚ÄúEdit / Paste special / Values only‚Äù). Otherwise Pattypan can‚Äôt see the formula result.

name: Sam Wilson
note:
I‚Äôm a programmer from Fremantle, Western Australia. I work for the Wikimedia Foundation and spend my spare time working on wikis, family history, and OpenStreetMap. I try to find time for some furniture-making.
Contact me by email, or on the fediverse/Mastodon as @samwilson@wikis.world, or on Matrix as @samwilson:matrix.org.
